thread.title: Princess Margaret’s Former Husband Lord Snowdon Dies at 86
thread.title_full: Princess Margaret’s Former Husband Lord Snowdon Dies at 86

author: Erin Hill
title: Princess Margaret’s Former Husband Lord Snowdon Dies at 86
text:
Lord Snowdon and Princess Margaret on their wedding day in 1960 Keystone-France/Gamma-Rapho/Getty 
Lord Snowdon, the former husband of Princess Margaret , died peacefully at his home on Friday, a family spokesman said. He was 86. 
Antony Charles Robert Armstrong-Jones, known as Lord Snowden, wed the princess in 1960. They had two children before divorcing in 1978. Lord Snowdon and Princess Margaret in 1974 Tom Wargacki/Getty 
He went on to marry his second wife, Lucy Mary Lindsay-Hogg, in 1978. The couple, who had one daughter, separated in 2000. 
The celebrated artist became the the royal photographer after his marriage to Princess Margaret. Among his works were the official portraits of Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip for their 1957 tour of Canada. 
In 2014, he donated a series of his photographs, including ones of David Bowie, Maggie Smith and Laurence Olivier to the National Portrait Gallery. Lord Snowdon in 2009 Claire R Greenway/Getty 
Before marrying Snowdon, Margaret had a highly-publicized relationship with Group Capt. Peter Townsend. The couple’s doomed love affair is featured on the hit Netflix series, The Crown . Show Full Article
